page.title: 08TWO FARMS IN WILMSLOW
page.content: NOON SUN FARM The main land-use at{Noon Sun Farm is{grass}for{silage.}Mr.Kirk{the owner farms{121 hectares. Cattle}and{pigs are raised on the farm which hasn't changed much over the years.The animals eat a lot.{Tractors}are very important machines on the farm.Two dogs help with herding the cows.Three men and two women work on the farm.Mr.Kirk spends his days{milking or making{silage,}he goes to market to sell and buy animals. The workers keep in contact by using{C.B}radios. HOLE FARM The main land use at{Hole Farm}is for feeding cattle and for making hay.Mr.Smith rents{16 hectares}of farm land. Mr.Smith has three tractors a mowing machine, a hay turner and one bailer.Mr.Smith and his son have{other {jobs}apart from working on the farm.
